title: Designing Cross-Cultural Remote Collaboration for Design Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics education theory and basic experience with digital collaboration tools
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers collaborate with peers from diverse cultural backgrounds on online mathematics design tasks, developing the ability to understand and navigate cultural differences.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain three major design patterns that arise in cross-cultural remote collaboration.
Learners can conduct inductive/deductive analysis of collaborative processes using a mixed-methods research approach.
Learners can propose localization strategies considering cultural differences in the mathematics education design process.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
